destinations.title: Azimir Oathgate
destinations.location: Azimir, capital of the Azish Empire, western Roshar
destinations.description: Connects Urithiru to the bustling, cosmopolitan capital of Azir, known for its bronze-domed buildings and scholarly culture. The Oathgate is a large, circular platform with intricate carvings, activated by a Radiant's Shardblade. It's a key trade and diplomatic hub in the series.

destinations.title: Thaylen City Oathgate
destinations.description: Links to the major port city of Thaylenah, a maritime trade center. The Oathgate is a raised platform with gemstone mechanisms, situated near the city's docks. It becomes critical for military movements in Oathbringer.

destinations.title: Kholinar Oathgate
destinations.location: Kholinar, capital of Alethkar, eastern Roshar
destinations.description: Connects to Alethkar's capital, a grand city with a palace and windblades (rock formations). The Oathgate is located on a platform outside the city but is compromised by the Voidbringers in Oathbringer, making it a focal point of conflict.

destinations.title: Vedenar Oathgate
destinations.location: Vedenar, capital of Jah Keved, central Roshar
destinations.description: Links to the coastal city of Vedenar, a cultural and political center of Jah Keved. The Oathgate is a large stone platform with spren-activated mechanisms, though it's less prominently featured in the series until later books.

destinations.title: Rall Elorim Oathgate
destinations.description: Connects to the 'City of Shadows' in Iri, a nation of golden-haired people and metallic landscapes. The Oathgate is a mystical platform tied to the region's spren and is less detailed in the books but functional for travel.

destinations.title: Rira Oathgate
destinations.description: Links to a location in Rira, a smaller nation west of Iri. The Oathgate is similar in design to others, with a circular platform and spren guardians, but its narrative role is minimal, mentioned mostly in passing.

destinations.title: Stormseat Oathgate
destinations.description: Connects to the ruined city of Stormseat, once Natanatan's capital, now called Narak. The Oathgate is central to the Shattered Plains' plot in Words of Radiance, buried under rubble until rediscovered and activated.

destinations.title: Shinovar Oathgate
destinations.location: Shin Kak Nish, Shinovar, far western Roshar
destinations.description: Links to Shinovar, a lush, Earth-like region with soil and grass, unlike the rest of Roshar. The Oathgate is a stone platform, less described but functional, connecting to this isolated region.

destinations.title: Rathalas Oathgate
destinations.description: Connects to the city of Rathalas, known as the Rift, a rocky region in Alethkar. The Oathgate is buried or damaged until later in the series, with its rediscovery tied to Alethi military campaigns.

destinations.title: Aimia Oathgate
destinations.description: Links to the mysterious island of Akinah in Aimia, a region shrouded in secrecy and guarded by ancient spren. The Oathgate is not fully operational until Rhythm of War and is tied to the series' deeper lore.
